column4: seems like my udev is missing the hid rule.. can anyone help me?
its more likely you have something in your xmodmap that is disabling the click
where can i config that?
i would check if the click is appearing in xev, then start looking in your . files
what exactly should i be searching for
do you see the clicks in xev?
its a command line tool
kb and mouse movement is working.. no clicks though :(
of any clicks or just the left?
just left click.. and mouse btn 4
so look at .Xmodmap, you might also investigate input settings with xinput
where's the xinput?? in the /etc/X11/xorg.conf?
no .Xmodmap in my home.
xinput is another command line tool. xinput --list to get the input id xinput --list-props # to see properties. what kind of mouse is this. normal usb mouse
it's a logitech bluetooth bundle
found the input device.. seems like the key is mapped for the mouse.. what now?
the key is mapped for the mouse. I dont know what that means. you might use xinput set-props if you think it is set wrong
currently button left is set to (124).. is that right? i don't know what's right...
what property is this
my xinput --list-props # showed me "Button Labels (255)" : Button Left (124)
i don't know. i dont have that property in my synaptic
